maml:description.maml:para: Adds word delimiters to the MS Terminal global settings.
Adds word delimiters to the MS Terminal global settings.

maml:Description.maml:para: A string with the delimiter or delimiters to add.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
A string with the delimiter or delimiters to add.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the # as a word delimiter (if it is not already in the string).

maml:description.maml:para: Converts an itermcolors file to a PowerShell object (or Hashtable).
Converts an itermcolors file to a PowerShell object (or Hashtable).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a path to one or more locations. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it is typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards. If the path includes escape characters, enclose it in single quotation marks. Single quotation marks tell PowerShell not to interpret any characters as escape sequences.
Return the color values as a hash table (suitable for splatting to New-MSTerminalColorScheme)

Specifies the path to the itermcolors file. Wildcard characters are permitted. The paths must be paths to items, not to containers. For example, you must specify a path to one or more files, not a path to a directory.
Return the color values as a hash table (suitable for splatting to New-MSTerminalColorScheme)
Return the color values as a hash table (suitable for splatting to New-MSTerminalColorScheme)

Specifies a path to one or more locations. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it is typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards. If the path includes escape characters, enclose it in single quotation marks. Single quotation marks tell PowerShell not to interpret any characters as escape sequences.

Specifies the path to the itermcolors file. Wildcard characters are permitted. The paths must be paths to items, not to containers. For example, you must specify a path to one or more files, not a path to a directory.

dev:type.maml:name: A path to an itermcolors file

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> ConvertFrom-Iterm2ColorScheme -Path .\file.itermcolors
brightRed : #E50000 cyan : #00A6B2 black : #000000 brightGreen : #00D900 green : #00A600 brightYellow : #E5E500 brightBlue : #0000FF background : #224FBC foreground : #FFFFFF blue : #0000B2 brightWhite : #E5E5E5 white : #BFBFBF brightBlack : #666666 brightCyan : #00E5E5 brightPurple : #E500E5 yellow : #999900 purple : #B200B2 red : #990000

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts file.itermcolors into a PowerShell object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> ConvertFrom-Iterm2ColorScheme -Path .\file.itermcolors -AsHashtable
Name Value ---- ----- brightRed #E50000 cyan #00A6B2 black #000000 brightGreen #00D900 green #00A600 brightYellow #E5E500 brightBlue #0000FF background #224FBC foreground #FFFFFF blue #0000B2 brightWhite #E5E5E5 white #BFBFBF brightBlack #666666 brightCyan #00E5E5 brightPurple #E500E5 yellow #999900 purple #B200B2 red #990000

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts file.itermcolors into a hash table suitable for splatting to New-MSTerminalColorScheme.

maml:description.maml:para: Locates the profiles.json file for MS Terminal
Locates the profiles.json file for MS Terminal.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Searches for the WindowsTermminalDev or Microsoft.WindowsTerminal folder in the current user's packages path.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the currently defined color schemes from the profiles.json file.
Returns the currently defined color schemes from the profiles.json file.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of a color scheme or a wildcard pattern.
The name of a color scheme or a wildcard pattern.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all currently defined color schemes.
Returns any color schemes with the name Campbell.
Returns any color schemes that match dark .

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the currently defined profiles from the profiles.json file.
Returns the currently defined profiles from the profiles.json file.

maml:Description.maml:para: Get the profile with the specified GUID.
The name of a profile or a wildcard pattern
Get the profile with the specified GUID.
The name of a profile or a wildcard pattern

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all currently defined profiles.
Returns any profiles with the name powershell.
Returns any profiles that match power .

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the current top-level settings for MS Terminal.
Returns the current top-level settings for MS Terminal.

maml:Description.maml:para: * Deprecated as of Terminal 0.2.1715.0 and will be removed in a future release of the module *
Use to force output to include the fully deserialized profiles.json file. If not specified, the 'profiles' and 'schemes' elements will be omitted.
* Deprecated as of Terminal 0.2.1715.0 and will be removed in a future release of the module *
Use to force output to include the fully deserialized profiles.json file. If not specified, the 'profiles' and 'schemes' elements will be omitted.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MSTerminalSetting
defaultProfile : {38782937-4ba3-4696-9ae1-0bfc33c60e62} initialRows : 30 initialCols : 120 alwaysShowTabs : True showTerminalTitleInTitlebar : True showTabsInTitlebar : False requestedTheme : system keybindings : {@{keys=System.Object[]; command=closeTab},...}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the current top-level settings for MS Terminal.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports an iterm2 color scheme file into MS Terminal.
Imports an iterm2 color scheme file into MS Terminal.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a path to one or more locations. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it is typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards. If the path includes escape characters, enclose it in single quotation marks. Single quotation marks tell PowerShell not to interpret any characters as escape sequences.
The name of the color scheme to create in MS Terminal. If no name is specified, the base file name will be used.

Specifies the path to the itermcolors file. Wildcard characters are permitted. The paths must be paths to items, not to containers. For example, you must specify a path to one or more files, not a path to a directory.
The name of the color scheme to create in MS Terminal. If no name is specified, the base file name will be used.

Specifies a path to one or more locations. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it is typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards. If the path includes escape characters, enclose it in single quotation marks. Single quotation marks tell PowerShell not to interpret any characters as escape sequences.
The name of the color scheme to create in MS Terminal. If no name is specified, the base file name will be used.

Specifies the path to the itermcolors file. Wildcard characters are permitted. The paths must be paths to items, not to containers. For example, you must specify a path to one or more files, not a path to a directory.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Imports the file .\file.itermcolors into MS Terminal as a new color scheme named "ColorScheme"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new color scheme named BrightBlue that overrides the blue color of the default colors (the Campbell scheme).

maml:description.maml:para: Generates a new array of colors for use in the -ColorTable parameter of New-MSTerminalProfile and Set-MSTerminalProfile.

Generates a new array of colors for use in the -ColorTable parameter of New-MSTerminalProfile and Set-MSTerminalProfile. All colors are optional with default values being provided from the built-in Campbell color scheme.

maml:Description.maml:para: The black color in hex color format "#rrggbb".
The blue color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The cyan color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The green color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The purple color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The red color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The white color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The yellow color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightBlack color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightBlue color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightCyan color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightGreen color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightPurple color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightRed color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightWhite color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightYellow color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The black color in hex color format "#rrggbb".
The blue color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightBlack color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightBlue color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightCyan color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightGreen color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightPurple color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightRed color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightWhite color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The brightYellow color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The cyan color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The green color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The purple color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The red color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The white color in hex color format "#rrggbb"
The yellow color in hex color format "#rrggbb"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Colors = @{ black = '#0C0C0C' blue = '#0037DA' brightBlack = '#767676' brightBlue = '#3B78FF' brightCyan = '#61D6D6' brightGreen = '#16C60C' brightPurple = '#B4009E' brightRed = '#E74856' brightWhite = '#F2F2F2' brightYellow = '#F9F1A5' cyan = '#3A96DD' green = '#13A10E' purple = '#881798' red = '#C50F1F' white = '#CCCCCC' yellow = '#C19C00' } PS C:\> $ColorTable = New-MSTerminalColorTable @Colors PS C:\> Set-MSTerminalProfile -Name PowerShell -ColorTable $ColorTable -ColorScheme $null

dev:remarks.maml:para: Generates a color table array and sets the profile named "PowerShell" to use the custom color table instead of a defined color scheme.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new MS Terminal profile.
Creates a new MS Terminal profile.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the profile.
The command line to run for this profile.
The size of the font
Sets the background color of the profile. Overrides "background" set in color scheme if "colorScheme" is set.
Sets the foreground color of the profile. Overrides foreground set in color scheme if colorscheme is set. Uses hex color format: "#rrggbb".
Sets the acrylic opacity, 0 being completely transparent and 1 being completely opaque. This should be a number between 0 and 1.
The path to an image to use as the background for the terminal window. This value is ignored if UseAcrylic is enabled.
Ex: "file:///c:/users/USER/Pictures/background.jpg"
Sets how the background image aligns to the boundaries of the window.
The background image opacity, a number between 0 and 1.
How to resize the background image.

Fill - The background is resized to fill the window. The aspect ratio is not preserved. None - The background image is kept at it's original dimensions. Uniform - The background image is resized to fill the window, preserving the aspect ratio. UniformToFill - The background image is resized to fill the window, clipping the image to make it fit the window and preserving the aspect ratio.
Defines the visibility of the scrollbar. Possible values: "visible", "hidden"
Overrides default title of the tab.
The number of lines of history to store.
The icon to use for this profile. Ex: "ms-appdata:///roaming/console.ico"
The padding to use between the window edges and the text.
A hashtable of additional settings to set in the profile. These entries are not validated and override other parameter settings, use at your own risk!
The name of the color scheme to use for this profile.

Array of colors used in the profile if colorscheme is not set. Colors use hex color format: "#rrggbb". Ordering is as follows: [black, red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white, bright black, bright red, bright green, bright yellow, bright blue, bright magenta, bright cyan, bright white]
The cursor color in the format "#RRGGBB"
The cursor shape.
Sets the height of the cursor. Only works when "cursorShape" is set to "vintage". Accepts values from 25-100.
The name of the font to use for this profile.
The working directory to start in.
Should MS Terminal close the tab when the program exits.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
If specified, this profile will become the default profile.
Enable the SnapOnInput setting.
Enable acrylic effects.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Sets the acrylic opacity, 0 being completely transparent and 1 being completely opaque. This should be a number between 0 and 1.
Sets the background color of the profile. Overrides "background" set in color scheme if "colorScheme" is set.
The path to an image to use as the background for the terminal window. This value is ignored if UseAcrylic is enabled.
Ex: "file:///c:/users/USER/Pictures/background.jpg"
Sets how the background image aligns to the boundaries of the window.
The background image opacity, a number between 0 and 1.
How to resize the background image.

Fill - The background is resized to fill the window. The aspect ratio is not preserved. None - The background image is kept at it's original dimensions. Uniform - The background image is resized to fill the window, preserving the aspect ratio. UniformToFill - The background image is resized to fill the window, clipping the image to make it fit the window and preserving the aspect ratio.
Should MS Terminal close the tab when the program exits.
The name of the color scheme to use for this profile.

Array of colors used in the profile if colorscheme is not set. Colors use hex color format: "#rrggbb". Ordering is as follows: [black, red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white, bright black, bright red, bright green, bright yellow, bright blue, bright magenta, bright cyan, bright white]
The command line to run for this profile.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The cursor color in the format "#RRGGBB"
Sets the height of the cursor. Only works when "cursorShape" is set to "vintage". Accepts values from 25-100.
The cursor shape.
A hashtable of additional settings to set in the profile. These entries are not validated and override other parameter settings, use at your own risk!
The name of the font to use for this profile.
The size of the font
Sets the foreground color of the profile. Overrides foreground set in color scheme if colorscheme is set. Uses hex color format: "#rrggbb".
The number of lines of history to store.
The icon to use for this profile. Ex: "ms-appdata:///roaming/console.ico"
If specified, this profile will become the default profile.
The name of the profile.
The padding to use between the window edges and the text.
Defines the visibility of the scrollbar. Possible values: "visible", "hidden"
Enable the SnapOnInput setting.
The working directory to start in.
Overrides default title of the tab.
Enable acrylic effects.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-MSTerminalProfile -Name pwsh -CommandLine "C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6\pwsh.exe -WorkingDirectory ~" -Background "#012456" -ColorScheme Campbell

Fill - The background is resized to fill the window. The aspect ratio is not preserved. None - The background image is kept at it's original dimensions. UniformToFill - The background image is resized to fill the window, clipping the image to make it fit the window and preserving the aspect ratio.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the "pwsh" profile to be the default and sets the font size to 14.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the top-level settings for MS Terminal.
Updates the top-level settings for MS Terminal.

maml:Description.maml:para: The GUID of the profile to launch when MS Terminal is opened. Use Get-MSTerminalProfile | Set-MSTerminalProfile -MakeDefault to set the default without using the GUID.
The number of rows to launch with.
The number of columns to launch with.
Sets the theme of the tab bar. Possible values: "light", "dark", "system"
Determines the delimiters used in a double click selection.
A list of global settings to remove. This takes precedence over any other value being set by this cmdlet.
{{ Fill ExtraSettings Description }}
Show tabs even when there is only a single console application running.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
When set, a selection is immediately copied to your clipboard upon creation. When set to false (-CopyOnSelect:$False), the selection persists and awaits further action.
If not specified or cleared, the terminal default value is $False.
When set to 'true', the tabs are moved into the titlebar and the titlebar disappears. When set to 'false', the titlebar sits above the tabs.
Show the current console application's title in the MS Terminal title bar.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Show tabs even when there is only a single console application running.
A list of global settings to remove. This takes precedence over any other value being set by this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
When set, a selection is immediately copied to your clipboard upon creation. When set to false (-CopyOnSelect:$False), the selection persists and awaits further action.
If not specified or cleared, the terminal default value is $False.
The GUID of the profile to launch when MS Terminal is opened. Use Get-MSTerminalProfile | Set-MSTerminalProfile -MakeDefault to set the default without using the GUID.
{{ Fill ExtraSettings Description }}
The number of columns to launch with.
The number of rows to launch with.
Sets the theme of the tab bar. Possible values: "light", "dark", "system"
When set to 'true', the tabs are moved into the titlebar and the titlebar disappears. When set to 'false', the titlebar sits above the tabs.
Show the current console application's title in the MS Terminal title bar.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Determines the delimiters used in a double click selection.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the inital rows to 50 and enables always showing tabs.

maml:description.maml:para: Used to switch the module target between the Dev, Release, and Standalone installations of Microsoft Terminal.
Used to switch the module target between the Dev, Release, and Standalone installations of Microsoft Terminal.

maml:Description.maml:para: A fully qualified path to the parent folder of a profiles.json file.
The application release to target for the module.

Release = Installed from Windows Store Standalone = Non-packaged version Dev = Compiled from source and installed via appx Clear = Enables the auto-discovery mode that searches for Release, Standalone, then Dev.
A fully qualified path to the parent folder of a profiles.json file.
The application release to target for the module.

Release = Installed from Windows Store Standalone = Non-packaged version Dev = Compiled from source and installed via appx Clear = Enables the auto-discovery mode that searches for Release, Standalone, then Dev.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Change the target profiles.json to the dev path (WindowsTerminalDev_8wekyb3d8bbwe)
Change the target profiles.json to the release path (Microsoft.WindowsTerminal_8wekyb3d8bbwe)
